graph2D

Class ComponentImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • graph2D.ComponentImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class ComponentImage
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    ComponentImage is like a canvas for drawing pixels, points or lines. There is also an Affine Transformation for translating coordinates from a real 2D space, as defined by the user, to a internal (user) coordinate system as given by the AWT
    Version:
    (1.2)
    Author:
    (CC-BY-NC-SA. IIP, PRG, EDA @ ETSINF-UPV. pmarques)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(double x1,
                     double y1,
                     double x2,
                     double y2,
                     java.awt.Color c,
                     int lW)
        Draws a line between (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) with Color c and width lW. Works in the real graphic space.
        Parameters:
        x1: - The abscise value of the first point.
        y1: - The ordinate value of the first point.
        x2: - The abscise value of the second point.
        y2: - The ordinate value of the second point.
        c: - Color of the line.
        lW: - int, line's width.

        Parameters:
        x: - The abscise value of the point.
        y: - The ordinate value of the point.
        c: - Color of the point.
        pW: - int, point's width.

        public double[] internalToRealTransform(int ix,
                                        int iy)
        Converts internal space coordinates (ix,iy) into real ones.
        Parameters:
        ix: - x-coordinate for the column value of the point to be represented.
        iy: - y-coordinate for the row value of the point to be represented.

      • modGraphDimensions

        public void modGraphDimensions(double mX,
                               double xX,
                               double mY,
                               double xY)
        Modify the Affine Tranformation calculus. For converting real space coordinates into user's (internal) one.
        Parameters:
        miX: - Minimum x value to be represented, miX < maX.
        maX: - Maximum x value to be represented, miX < maX.
        miY: - Minimum y value to be represented, miY < maY.
        maY: - Maximum y value to be represented, miY < maY.
